findings.title: H1: BoostedMasterChefJoe may get stuck due to an invariant violation
findings.description: Invariant violation in BoostedMasterChefJoe contract causing denial of service.

findings.title: H2: Transferring tokens to BoostedMasterChefJoe before first deposit may cause DoS
findings.description: Causing denial of service by sending a negligible amount of tokens to the contract.

findings.title: H3: Many components lack data validation
findings.description: Lack of data validation in many components.

findings.title: H4: Renounce ownership
findings.description: Access control issue due to renounce ownership functionality.

findings.title: H5: setBoostedMasterChefJoe has insufficient data validation
findings.description: Insufficient data validation in setBoostedMasterChefJoe function.

findings.title: H6: Tokens with callbacks
findings.description: Tokens with callbacks can cause re-entrancy vulnerabilities.

findings.title: H7: Usage of solc optimizer
findings.description: The solc optimizer may lead to unexpected bugs.

findings.title: M1: Setting anyAuth to true leads to undefined behavior
findings.description: Allowing anyone to set bridges, which can lead to denial of service and re-entrancy attacks.

findings.title: M2: Array lengths are not validated
findings.description: Multiple publicly-entrypoints accept multiple arrays as parameters without checking their lengths.

findings.title: M3: Renewing boosting period can fail
findings.description: Users can spend JOE tokens meaninglessly if they deposit them with the thought of extending the boosting period.

findings.title: L1: Code duplication in MoneyMaker
findings.description: Duplicate code in getAmountOut functions in MoneyMaker and JoeLibrary contracts.

findings.title: W1: OpenZeppelin dependencies contain bugs
findings.description: Outdated versions of OpenZeppelin dependencies used in the project have known vulnerabilities.

findings.title: W2: Front-runnning initialize function
findings.description: An attacker can front-run the initialization of a newly created contract and call arbitrary functions in it.

findings.title: W3: getPendingVeJoe does not have up to date values
findings.description: getPendingVeJoe function may return outdated results because it doesn't updateRewardVars.

findings.title: W4: Pre-0.8 solc versions donâ€™t check for arithmetic overflow
findings.description: Older versions of the solc compiler do not check for arithmetic overflows and underflows.

findings.title: I1: MoneyMaker.authorized keeps old values
findings.description: authorized array in MoneyMaker contract is not updated when an address is removed.
findings.location: MoneyMaker contract, addAuth and revokeAuth functions

findings.title: I2: Use _msgSender over msg.sender
findings.description: Contracts should use _msgSender instead of msg.sender for future-proofness.
findings.location: Contracts that inherit from Context or ContextUpgradeable, /* */

findings.title: I3: Log old values in logs
findings.description: Logs don't include old values when logging important state changes.
